text.headline: Flor de las Ystorias de Orient
text.text:
In Poitiers, the Armenian Prince and cleric, Hethoum of Korykos, presented a unique manuscript to Pope Clement V. This work wasn't just a crusade proposal; it was a treasure trove of information about the geography, history, and cultures of the 'East.'

Hethoum's work quickly gained fame across Europe. Between 1382 and 1396, it was translated into Aragonese by Juan Fernandez de Heredia in Avignon.

This special interactive edition combines the original text and cartographic knowledge of the time, bringing the medieval world's view of the East to life.
